alert.note: Alert for Chaves County Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 4:55PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL CHAVES COUNTY THROUGH 530 PM MDT... At 455 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dexter, or 11 miles southeast of Roswell, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southern Roswell, Dexter, Hagerman, Bottomless Lakes State Park, Greenfield, Roswell Correctional Facility and Midway. This includes Highway 285 between Mile Markers 89 and 103. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.
